For many years, the average temperature in Denali was 31 degrees but starting in 2014 it has steadily risen, melting the permafrost that holds the land together.

We are among some of the only people who have visited Pretty Rocks Landslide, which has wiped out the only road in @DenaliNPS and therefore restricted visitors to only the first 40 miles of the park. #SEECingDenal http://pbs.twimg.com/media/F0cTHpQWYAwgWLq.jpg

These continue to be challenging times in healthcare and it will take thoughtful, creative solutions to work our way out. Thank you to all who participated today and shared their perspective on how the federal government can deliver meaningful and impactful solutions.

It‚Äôs why I co-founded the bipartisan Domestic Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Caucus and have introduced legislation, like the Ensuring Access to Lifesaving Drugs Act, to keep vital medicines on pharmacy shelves.
This issue of supply-chains for critical items has become a bit of an obsession of mine since shortages upended our economy during the pandemic.

In May, my team and I began hearing serious concerns about the shortage from our hospital leaders, and today they had the opportunity to describe in detail to Sec. Becerra what they have been experiencing.

Top of the agenda: the ongoing shortage of lifesaving cancer drugs that has forced our hospitals in Michigan to ration care. This crisis has shown once again that maintaining a sufficient supply of pharmaceuticals is critical for not just patients, but for our national security.

It‚Äôs so important for leaders in Washington to know what‚Äôs happening on the ground in Michigan, which is why I wanted @SecBecerra to visit our district and hear directly from state hospital leaders about the issues they‚Äôre facing. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/F0dltJOXsAA469a.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/F0dluFTWwAA-FPA.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/F0dluNCX0AMq6HR.jpg
